text: The pride of the great city had finally come true. He already had ten million cars. Almost no one was passing through the streets and the sidewalks were suppressed. At most on some city roads they had left a kind of pedestrian alert for unfortunate people. But that afternoon of a summer Sunday, characterized by heavy weather, the gases from the ten million cars intoxicated the entire city and the tourists who arrived at dawn were met with the sad spectacle of all the slumside residents, fallen on the couches of their cars, forever catapulted by suffocation. FIN
title: Diez millones de automóviles
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna
